intro: Paepalanthus schlechtendalii, commonly known as the Schlechtendal's pincushion. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Bolivia. This species belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that collect water. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the summer. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
